definition: (of a lathe) equipped with gearing for reducing the speed of the spindle from that of the driving pulley
details:
adjective
- (of a lathe) equipped with gearing for reducing the speed of the spindle from that of the driving pulley
= synonyms: back-geared
- equipped with compound gearing consisting of 2 pinions and 2 wheels in mesh to increase the mechanical advantage
= example: equipped with compound gearing consisting of 2 pinions and 2 wheels in mesh to increase the mechanical advantage
